props.name: title
props.description: title to be displayed at the top of the tooltip

props.name: content
props.description: tooltip content

props.name: event
props.description: if set to `click`, tooltip is toggled when clicking on beacon; if set to `hover`, the tooltip is activated via hovering

props.name: placement
props.description: placement of the tooltip relative to `target` (either `top`, `top-start`, `top-end`, `bottom`, `bottom-end`, `left`, `left-start`, `left-end`, `right`, `right-start`, `right-end`, `auto`, or `center`)

props.name: target
props.description: class or ID selector for element to attach tooltip to

props.name: offset
props.description: distance between the tooltip and `target` in pixels

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback invoked upon state change of the tooltip. Receives two arguments: the `action` (`open` or `close`) and the passed `props`

BeaconTooltip.description: Component placeing a beacon in the lesson, either independently or attached to a `target`. Upon hovering or clicking on the beacon, a tooltip is displayed.

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

Clock.description: Clock component displaying the current time.

props.name: color
props.description: `string` holding an HeX code or an `object` holding RGB or HSL values such as `{ r: 255, g: 255, b: 255 }` or `{ h: 0, s: 0, l: .10 }`, which determines the active color. Both accept an `a` property for alpha values other than one

props.name: disableAlpha
props.description: controls whether to remove alpha slider and options

props.name: presetColors
props.description: HeX `strings` specifying the default colors at the bottom of the colorpicker

props.name: width
props.description: width of the colorpicker (in px)

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback invoked every time color is changed

props.name: onChangeComplete
props.description: callback invoked once a color change is complete

props.name: fluid
props.description: turn any fixed-width Ccntainer layout into a full-width layout

props.name: bandwidth
props.description: smoothing parameter for the kernel density estimator

props.name: histogram
props.description: show a histogram alongside the density plot

props.name: nBins
props.description: number of bins for the overlaid histogram.

props.name: vline
props.description: if supplied, will display a vertical line at the supplied `value` with a given `label`

props.name: xlab
props.description: x-axis label

props.name: xmax
props.description: maximum value displayed on the x-axis

props.name: xmin
props.description: minimum value displayed on the x-axis

props.name: ymax
props.description: maximum value displayed on the y-axis

props.name: width
props.description: width of the plot (in px)

props.name: height
props.description: height of the plot (in px)

props.name: autoStart
props.description: if set to `true`, the `onGenerate` function is executed at startup with the default input values

props.name: autoUpdate
props.description: controls whether the `onGenerate` function should be invoked automatically when one of the child input fields changes

props.name: description
props.description: dashboard description

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether the dashboard shall be disabled

props.name: label
props.description: button label

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: maximum width of dashboard

props.name: onGenerate
props.description: function invoked when the button is clicked or one of the dashboard input values changes (if `autoUpdate` is set to `true`). The function is called with the values of the input fields, in the order in which they are placed in the dashboard

props.name: title
props.description: card title

Dashboard.description: A dashboard for combining the handling of multiple child input fields.

props.name: categorical
props.description: array of strings indicating the name of each categorical variable

props.name: continuous
props.description: array of strings indicating the name of each continuous variable

props.name: data
props.description: data object or array to be viewed. If it is an object, the keys correspond to column values while an array will expect an array of objects with a named field corresponding to each column. If you wish to allow students the ability to import a `.csv` file, set the `data` option to be `false`

props.name: dataInfo
props.description: object containing the keys \'name\', whose value is a string, \'info\', whose value is an array of strings in which each element in the array is a new line and \'variables\', an object with keys as variable names and values as variable descriptions

props.name: distributions
props.description: array of strings indicating distributions that may be used in calculating probabilities. This functionality exists independently of the dataset provided. Currently limited to normal, uniform and exponential distributions

props.name: editorProps
props.description: object to be passed to `MarkdownEditor` indicating properties to be used

props.name: editorTitle
props.description: string indicating the title of the explorer to be displayed

props.name: hideDataTable
props.description: boolean value indicating whether to hide the data table from view

props.name: histogramDensities
props.description: boolean value indicating whether to display histogram densities

props.name: models
props.description: array of strings indicating models that may be fit on the data

props.name: opened
props.description: page opened at startup

props.name: plots
props.description: array of strings indicating which plots to show to the user

props.name: questions
props.description: node indicating surrounding text and question components to be displayed in a tabbed window

props.name: showEditor
props.description: boolean indicating whether to show the editor to the user

props.name: showTestDecisions
props.description: boolean indicating whether to show the decisions made for each test based on the calculated p-values

props.name: statistics
props.description: array of strings indicating which summary statistics may be calculated

props.name: tables
props.description: array of strings indicating which tables may be created from the data

props.name: tabs
props.description: array of objects and keys indicating any custom tabs to add

props.name: tests
props.description: array of strings indicating which hypothesis tests to include

props.name: transformer
props.description: boolean indicating whether one wants to display a variable transformer

DataExplorer.description: This component is used by students to briefly summarize data as it is presented and perform various statistical tests.

props.name: data
props.description: A data object or array to be viewed. If it is an object, the keys correspond to column values while an array will expect an array of objects with a named field corresponding to each column

props.name: dataInfo
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: onClickRemove
props.description: A function specifying an action to take for rows removed from the data. Defaults to an empty function

props.name: showRemove
props.description: A boolean value indicating whether to allow for rows to be removed

props.name: style
props.description: An object allowing for custom css styling. Defaults to an empty object

DataTable.description: A component rendering data in a tabular display. Built on top of [react-table](https://react-table.js.org/).

props.name: isDraggable
props.description: controls whether grid elements are draggable

props.name: isResizable
props.description: controls whether grid elements are resizable

props.name: rowHeight
props.description: height of a single row (in px)

props.name: data
props.description: array of objects with `id` and `text` keys

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback invoked with newly ordered data array on each change

props.name: onInit
props.description: callback function invoked after mounting of component

props.name: shuffle
props.description: controls whether data elements should be shuffled in initial display

DraggableList.description: A list of draggable elements that can be re-ordered by the students.

props.name: enlargeable
props.description: controls whether items can be enlarged

props.name: enlargedHeight
props.description: height of item after enlarging it

props.name: isDraggable
props.description: controls whether the grid elements are draggable

props.name: isResizable
props.description: controls whether the grid elements are resizable

props.name: itemHeight
props.description: height of items (in px)

props.name: active
props.description: controls whether the counter should be active

props.name: delay
props.description: number of milliseconds before component disappears

Expire.description: The expire component will cause all of its children to become invisible after a specified amount of time.

props.name: vertical
props.description: buttons are displayed vertically if set to `true`

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: question
props.description: the question displayed at the top of the free text question component

props.name: hints
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: hintPlacement
props.description: placement of the hints (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: feedback
props.description: controls whether to display feedback buttons

props.name: solution
props.description: a model answer to the problem

props.name: rows
props.description: number of rows of the text field for students to type their answers

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether to enable group chat should for the question

props.name: resizable
props.description: controls whether the text area should be resizable

props.name: placeholder
props.description: placeholder text displayed before user has entered any text

props.name: submissionMsg
props.description: notification displayed when the learner first submits his answer

props.name: resubmissionMsg
props.description: notification displayed for all submissions after the first one
props.default: You have successfully re-submitted your answer.

props.name: provideFeedback
props.description: indicates whether feedback including the correct answer should be displayed after learners submit their answers

props.name: maxlength
props.description: maximum allowed number of characters

props.name: voiceID
props.description: voice control identifier

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback invoked every time the text area value changes; receives the current text as its sole argument

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback invoked when user submits an answer; receives the submitted text as its sole argument

FreeTextQuestion.description: An ISLE component for questions where answers by students should be supplied in the form of free text.

props.name: allowMultipleAnswers
props.description: controls whether one wishes to allow students to answer the survey multiple times

props.name: anonymous
props.description: controls whether student answers are anonymized

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback function called when an answer is submitted

props.name: question
props.description: the question to ask the students

props.name: rows
props.description: number of text rows in the input field

FreeTextSurvey.description: An ISLE component for questions where the answers by the students should be supplied in the form of free text. What differentiates this component from the **FreeTextQuestion** is the fact that the aggregated group data is displayed to everyone in real-time.

props.name: anonymous
props.description: when set the gated content is displayed to anybody

props.name: user
props.description: when set the gated content is displayed to subscribed users

props.name: enrolled
props.description: when set the gated content is displayed to the students enrolled in the course

props.name: owner
props.description: when set the gated content is displayed to the owner of the course (usually the instructor)

props.name: banner
props.description: a message which is visible to the visitors lacking the gate privilege

props.name: disabled
props.description: if a gate is disabled, the banner will be displayed no matter what

Gate.description: An ISLE component that allows to display its children only to reserved audiences.

props.name: src
props.description: source URL

props.name: bind
props.description: name of global variable for the checkbox value to be assigned to

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: A boolean value indicating the default value of the checkbox

props.name: disabled
props.description: indicates whether the input is active or not

props.name: inline
props.description: indicates whether the checkbox is displayed inline

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback function to be invoked when checkbox is clicked. The function is called with the current checkbox value

props.name: legend
props.description: text displayed next to the checkbox'

CheckboxInput.description: A checkbox input component. Can be used as part of an ISLE dashboard or standalone. In the latter case, you want to handle changes via the `onChange` attribute or bind the value to a global variable via the `bind` attribute.

props.name: bind
props.description: : name of global variable for the number to be assigned to

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: value indicating the default value of the input at startup

props.name: disabled
props.description: boolean indicating whether the input is active or not

props.name: inline
props.description: indicates whether the input is displayed inline

props.name: legend
props.description: string indicating the text displayed next to the number input

props.name: max
props.description: number indicating the maximum value that may be inserted

props.name: min
props.description: number indicating the smallest possible value that may be inserted

props.name: numbersOnly
props.description: controls whether only numbers are accepted

props.name: onBlur
props.description: callback function to be invoked when using a blur method

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback function to be invoked when number input is changed

props.name: step
props.description: number indicating the incremental changes when using the increment arrows

props.name: value
props.description: number value (for controlled component)

props.name: width
props.description: number indicating the width of the input bar in pixels

NumberInput.description: A number input component. Can be used as part of an ISLE dashboard or standalone. In the latter case, you want to handle changes via the `onChange` attribute or bind the value to a global variable via the `bind` attribute.

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether the input field is deactivated

props.name: height
props.description: proportions input height (in px)

props.name: innerRadius
props.description: inner radius of proportions pie chart (in px)

props.name: legends
props.description: group labels

props.name: margin
props.description: proportion input margin (in px)

props.name: nElements
props.description: number of elements

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback function to be invoked when a choice is made

props.name: precision
props.description: displayed precision of proportion values

props.name: step
props.description: the step of the arrows seen when hovering the cursor above the input box

ProportionsInput.description: A proportions input component. Can be used as part of an ISLE dashboard or standalone. In the latter case, you want to handle changes via the `onChange` attribute or bind the value to a global variable via the `bind` attribute.

props.name: bind
props.description: name of global variable for the number to be assigned to

props.name: clearable
props.description: boolean value indicating whether one may clear choice(s) made

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: default value of the input at startup

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether the input is active or not

props.name: inline
props.description: indicates whether the input is displayed inline

props.name: legend
props.description: text displayed next to the input

props.name: multi
props.description: controls whether one may select multiple answers

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback function to be invoked when a choice is made

props.name: options
props.description: array of indicating the choices available the user

props.name: placeholder
props.description: value to be displayed before an initial choice is made

SelectInput.description: A select input component. Can be used as part of an ISLE dashboard or standalone. In the latter case, you want to handle changes via the `onChange` attribute or bind the value to a global variable via the `bind` attribute.

SliderInput.description: A slider input component. Can be used as part of an ISLE dashboard or standalone. In the latter case, you want to handle changes via the `onChange` attribute or bind the value to a global variable via the `bind` attribute.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: A value indicating the default value of the input at start

props.name: legend
props.description: A string indicating the text displayed next to the number input

props.name: inline
props.description: Indicates whether the input is displayed inline

props.name: onChange
props.description: A function to be called when a text value is changed

props.name: placeholder
props.description: A string indicating the value to be displayed before an initial choice is made

props.name: width
props.description: A number indicating the width of the input in pixels

TextInput.description: A text input component. Can be used as part of an ISLE dashboard or standalone. In the latter case, you want to handle changes via the `onChange` attribute or bind the value to a global variable via the `bind` attribute.

props.name: autorecord
props.description: controls whether to automatically start recording

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: default text value

props.name: grammars
props.description: speech grammar list (unsupported)

props.name: language
props.description: language identifier

props.name: legend
props.description: legend displayed in front of input field

props.name: mode
props.description: set to `full` to display a text input field alongside the microphone, `status` to only display a statusbar with the transcribed texts, `microphone` to show just a button to toggle recording, or `none` when the voice input should be invisible and purely controlled via hotkeys / voice commands

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback function invoked when text input value is updated

props.name: onClick
props.description: callback function invoked when clicking on the microphone button

props.name: onFinalText
props.description: callback function invoked once final text is received

props.name: onRecordingStart
props.description: callback function invoked when recording is started

props.name: onRecordingStop
props.description: callback function invoked once recording is stopped

props.name: onSegment
props.description: callback function invoked with text segments

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback function when submitting text input value by hitting "Enter"

props.name: placeholder
props.description: text input placeholder

props.name: remote
props.description: object with `start`, `stop`, and `toggle` and associated hotkeys

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: timeout
props.description: number of milliseconds after which to timeout the recording

props.name: stopTooltip
props.description: tooltip message desplayed while recording

props.name: startTooltip
props.description: tooltip message desplayed while not recording

props.name: width
props.description: voice input width (in px)

props.name: height
props.description: voice input height (in px)

props.name: run
props.description: controls whether the guide is active

props.name: steps
props.description: array of step `objects`

Joyride.description: Wrapper around [react-joyride](https://github.com/gilbarbara/react-joyride) to create walkthroughs and guided tours.

props.name: code
props.description: JavaScript code to be evaluated

props.name: solution
props.description: for programming questions, code `string` representing the official solution for the problem

props.name: hints
props.description: for programming questions, an array of hints providing guidance on how to approach the problem

props.name: precompute
props.description: controls whether the default code should be executed once the component has mounted

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether group chat functionality should be enabled

props.name: check
props.description: appended JavaScript code to check the `code` to be evaluated

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether to disable all user inputs and make the code block static

props.name: lines
props.description: number of lines to display

props.name: onEvaluate
props.description: callback invoked whenever the `Evaluate` button is clicked

props.name: vars
props.description: scope object with variables that should be made available to evaluated `code`

JSShell.description: An interactive Javascript shell that can be used to execute JavaScript commands. The shell contains a console that displays error messages, warnings etc.

props.name: actions
props.description: object mapping key codes to events

props.name: container
props.description: DOM node for which to attach event listeners

props.name: header
props.default: Measures of Location: Mean vs. Median

props.name: label
props.description: label of submit button

props.name: message
props.description: message for confirmation email

props.name: sendConfirmationEmail
props.description: controls whether to send confirmation email upon lesson submission

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onClick
props.description: callback invoked when clicking on the submission button

LessonSubmit.description: A button to be displayed at the end of a lesson for students to click on. By default, a message confirming completion of the lesson is sent to their email address.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: default text of the editor

props.name: toolbarConfig
props.description: array of toolbar element identifiers to be displayed

props.name: options
props.description: options passed to the SimpleMDE constructor, the package on which this component is based; see their documentation for available options

props.name: autoSave
props.description: controls whether the editor should save the current text to the local storage of the browser at a given time interval

props.name: intervalTime
props.description: time between auto saves

props.name: voiceControl
props.description: controls whether voice input is enabled

props.name: voiceTimeout
props.description: time in milliseconds after a chunk of recorded voice input is inserted

props.name: language
props.description: language identifier

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback invoked when editor text changes; receives the current text as its sole argument

MarkdownEditor.description: A markdown editor for writing notes or reports. Supports exporting of notes as HTML or PDF files, as well as automatic submission to the ISLE server.

props.name: question
props.description: question to be displayed at the top of the match list question component

props.name: elements
props.description: an `array` holding the correct pairs displayed at the top of the free text question component. Each `array` element must be an `object` with `a` and `b` properties

props.name: hintPlacement
props.description: placement of the hints (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: hints
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: showSolution
props.description: indicates whether the solution should be accessible after learners submit their answers

props.name: feedback
props.description: controls whether to display feedback buttons

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether the element should have an integrated chat

props.name: colorScale
props.description: if set, the supplied colors are used for the tiles

props.name: submissionMsg
props.description: notification displayed when the learner first submits his answer
props.default: You have successfully submitted your answer.

props.name: resubmissionMsg
props.description: notification displayed for all submissions after the first one
props.default: You have successfully re-submitted your answer.

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback invoked when students submits an answer

MatchListQuestion.description: An ISLE component that renders a question in which the learner has to match elements from two lists with each other in the correct way.

props.name: for
props.description: ID of component whose actions should be retrieved

props.name: interval
props.description: interval at which to call the database; if falsy, retrievals have to be manually triggered by clicking on the displayed button

props.name: onData
props.description: callback function called with an array of all actions

Metrics.description: Component allowing retrieval of member actions corresponding to a specified component ID from the database.

props.name: for
props.description: ID of component whose actions should trigger callback(s)

props.name: onData
props.description: callback function called with an array of all actions when a new member action arrives

props.name: onDatum
props.description: callback function invoked with every individual incoming member action

props.name: returnFullObject
props.description: controls whether to invoke the supplied callback(s) with the full action object or only its value

RealtimeMetrics.description: Invisible component listening to incoming member actions and invoking a given callback.

props.name: question
props.description: the question displayed at the top of the multiple choice component

props.name: solution
props.description: number denoting which answer is correct or an `array` of the correct answer numbers in case the learner should be able to select multiple answers

props.name: answers
props.description: an `array` of answer objects. Each answer should be an object with `content` and `explanation` fields, which denote the displayed answer option and an explanation visible after the question has been submitted to explain why the answer is correct or incorrect

props.name: hintPlacement
props.description: placement of the hints (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: hints
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: feedback
props.description: controls whether to display feedback buttons

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether the question is disabled

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether the element should have an integrated chat

props.name: provideFeedback
props.description: indicates whether feedback including the correct answer should be displayed after learners submit their answers

props.name: displaySolution
props.description: controls whether the solution is displayed upfront

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback invoked after an answer is submitted

MultipleChoiceQuestion.description: An ISLE component that renders a multiple choice question. It supports the case where the learner has to select a single answer and when there might be multiple correct answers and all correct ones must be picked.

props.name: allowMultipleAnswers
props.description: contols whether one wishes to allow students to answer the survey multiple times

props.name: anonymous
props.description: contols whether student answers are anonymized

props.name: answers
props.description: array indicating answer choices for the students

props.name: multipleAnswers
props.description: indicates whether students may select more than one answer. Note that this differs from allowMultipleAnswers in that allow makes students able to submit the question multiple times

props.name: title
props.description: panel title

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: function to be called when an answer is submitted

props.name: question
props.description: string indicating the question to ask the students

MultipleChoiceSurvey.description: A survey component in which the instructor may collect multiple-choice survey data from students in real-time.

props.name: invisible
props.description: indicates whether to show the input fields or rely solely on voice control to be triggered

props.name: key
props.description: authentication key for the News API

props.name: language
props.description: language identifier

props.name: voiceID
props.description: voice control identifier

props.name: onArticles
props.description: callback function invoked with an array of article objects once they are received

News.description: The **News** component scans the public **News API** (consisting of 71 international  newspapers) and displays the latest 10 articles of the given newspaper. There are two ways to enter a source: one by typing into the search field and submitting via the ENTER button, the second via voice.

props.name: question
props.description: number question

props.name: hintPlacement
props.description: placement of the hints (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: hints
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: feedback
props.description: controls whether to display feedback buttons

props.name: solution
props.description: a numeric answer to the problem

props.name: digits
props.description: number of digits for which the answer supplied by the student must match the solution to be considered correct. Set to 0 to match as an integer. If set to null it will search for an exact match.

props.name: max
props.description: maximum allowed input value

props.name: min
props.description: minimum allowed input value

props.name: provideFeedback
props.description: indicates whether feedback including the correct answer should be displayed after learners submit their answers

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether the element should have an integrated chat

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback  which is triggered after the value of the number field changes; receives the current value as its sole argument

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback invoked when answer is submitted; has as first parameter a `boolean` indicating whether the answer was correctly anwered (if applicable, `null` otherwise) and the supplied answer as the second parameter

props.name: question
props.description: the question to be displayed

props.name: allowMultipleAnswers
props.description: controls whether the same user (or session if anonymous) may submit multiple answers)

props.name: anonymous
props.description: Allows for the students to submit data anonymously. Note that if this option is set to "true", then the instructors will be unable to see the ID of the submitting student

props.name: step
props.description: A `string` or `numeric` value indicating the step of the arrows seen when hovering the cursor above the input box. If `'any'`, the step will be set to `1`

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback function invoked once students submits an answer

NumberSurvey.description: A survey component in which the instructor may collect numeric survey data from students in real-time.

props.name: question
props.description: question for which the student has to bring the available `options` into the correct order

props.name: options
props.description: an array of objects with `id` and `text` keys which the student has to bring into the correct ordering, which is assumed to be the supplied order

props.name: provideFeedback
props.description: controls whether to show a notification displaying whether the submitted answer is correct or not

props.name: hintPlacement
props.description: placement of the hints (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: hints
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: feedback
props.description: controls whether to display feedback buttons

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether the element should have an integrated chat

props.name: failureMsg
props.description: message to be displayed when student submits a wrong answer

props.name: successMsg
props.description: message to be displayed when student submits the correct answer

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback  which is triggered after dragging an element; has two parameters: a `boolean` indicating whether the elements were placed in the correct order and and `array` with the current ordering

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback invoked when answer is submitted; has as a sole parameter a `boolean` indicating whether the elements were placed in the correct order

OrderQuestion.description: An order question component that asks student to bring a collection of elements into the correct order.

props.name: title
props.description: displayed title of the pages container

props.name: size
props.description: size of the pagination buttons (one of `default`, `lg`, `large`, `sm`, `small`, `xs`, or `xsmall`)

props.name: height
props.description: the maximum height of the container. If an embedded page is taller, a vertical scrollbar is added

props.name: voiceID
props.description: voice control identifier

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onSelect
props.description: Function invoked when active change is changed. Receives the new active page index as a sole parameter

Pages.description: An ISLE pagination component that allows the user to step through a sequence of pages.

props.name: header
props.description: panel heading (h3)

props.name: code
props.description: code to be displayed in the playground box. This code will be editable by the user in the brower or lesson

props.name: scope
props.description: scope object with variables / components which should be made available to the executed code; most often this is the name of the component you wish to display

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

Playground.description: Playground component to experiment with ISLE components.

props.name: data
props.description: data array

props.name: editable
props.description: controls whether labels of the created plot are editable

props.name: id
props.description: component identifier

props.name: layout
props.description: Plotly layout object

props.name: legendButtons
props.description: controls whether to display buttons for changing the legend

props.name: onShare
props.description: callback function invoked when clicking on the "Share" button

props.name: removeButtons
props.description: controls whether to remove all buttons

props.name: toggleFullscreen
props.description: controls whether to display the plot in fullscreen mode

props.name: allowMultipleAnswers
props.description: contols whether one wishes to allow students to answer the survey multiple times

props.name: anonymous
props.description: contols whether student answers are anonymized

props.name: colors
props.description: array of colors for the pie chart components. If not defined, a custom color scale will be used

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether the survey is deactivated

props.name: group
props.description: group display heading

props.name: groupHeight
props.description: proportions input height for group display (in px)

props.name: groupInnerRadius
props.description: inner radius of proportions pie chart for group display (in px)

props.name: legends
props.description: legend labels that describe the options to be weighed

props.name: margin
props.description: proportion input margin (in px)

props.name: nElements
props.description: number of elements that shall be weighed

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback function invoked once students submits an answer

props.name: personalHeight
props.description: proportions input height for individual student (in px)

props.name: personalInnerRadius
props.description: inner radius of proportions pie chart for individual student (in px)

props.name: precision
props.description: displayed precision of proportion values

props.name: question
props.description: the question to be displayed

props.name: step
props.description: the step of the arrows seen when hovering the cursor above the input box

ProportionsSurvey.description: Component that allows a group of people to vote on the weights and importance of given options.

props.name: confidence
props.description: whether to display a Likert scale asking for the confidence of the user's answer

props.name: forceConfidence
props.description: controls whether a user has to supply a confidence level before moving to the next question

props.name: count
props.description: number of questions to include in the quiz

props.name: questions
props.description: array of questions from which questions will be randomly selected

props.name: active
props.description: controls whether the timer for the quiz is active

props.name: duration
props.description: duration of the quiz; once time is up, the summary page will be displayed

props.name: skippable
props.description: controls whether questions in  the quiz are skippable

props.name: onFinished
props.description: callback invoked when the quiz is finished and the results page is displayed

Quiz.description: A quiz component displaying a sequence of question components.

props.name: func
props.description: name of the `R function` for which to open the documentation. If not supplied, the content of the `RHelp` tag is assumed to be equal to the name of the function

props.name: library
props.description: name of the R package in which the function resides

props.name: visible
props.description: controls whether the help modal window should be opened at startup

RHelp.description: Make words pull up R documentation in a modal window when clicked.

props.name: code
props.description: R code used to evaluate

props.name: libraries
props.description: R libraries that should be loaded automatically when the input `code` is executed

props.name: prependCode
props.description: R code (or `array` of code blocks) to be prepended to the code stored in `code` when evaluating

ROutput.description: Component for rendering R output inside an ISLE lesson.

props.name: code
props.description: R code to generate the plot

props.name: width
props.description: width of the plot (in px)

props.name: height
props.description: height of the plot (in px)

props.name: fileType
props.description: file type of the plot (`png` or `svg`)

props.name: libraries
props.description: R libraries that should be loaded automatically when the input `code` is executed

props.name: prependCode
props.description: `string` or an `array` of R code snippets to be prepended to the code stored in `code` when evaluating

props.name: onDone
props.description: callback invoked with `err`, `img` and `body` arguments once a plot is created

RPlot.description: Component for rendering an R plot inside an ISLE lesson.

props.name: code
props.description: R code to be evaluated

props.name: solution
props.description: for programming questions, R code `string` representing the official solution for the problem

props.name: hints
props.description: for programming questions, an array of hints providing guidance on how to approach the problem

props.name: addPreceding
props.description: if set to true, the shell will evaluate all the code from the current component and all previous ones occurring in the lesson

props.name: libraries
props.description: R libraries that should be loaded automatically when the input `code` is executed

props.name: precompute
props.description: controls whether the default code should be executed once the component has mounted

props.name: prependCode
props.description: R code `string` (or `array` of R code blocks) to be prepended to the code stored in `code` when evaluating

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether group chat functionality should be enabled

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether to disable all user inputs and make the code block static

props.name: fontFamily
props.description: font-family used in the shell window

props.name: fontSize
props.description: used font size in the shell window

props.name: lines
props.description: number of lines to display

props.name: resettable
props.description: controls whether to display a reset button for restoring the default code input

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onEvaluate
props.description: callback invoked whenever the `Evaluate` button is clicked

props.name: onResult
props.description: callback invoked whenever the result of a code execution is obtained from the cloud. The result `string` is passed as the only argument to the callback function

RShell.description: An interactive R Shell that can be used to execute R commands in the cloud using [OpenCPU](https://www.opencpu.org/).

props.name: code
props.description: R code returning a data.frame containing the data to be displayed in the table

props.name: libraries
props.description: R libraries that should be loaded automatically when the input `code` is executed

props.name: prependCode
props.description: R code `string` (or `array` of R code blocks) to be prepended to the code stored in `code` when evaluating

props.name: width
props.description: width (between 0 and 1)

RTable.description: Component for rendering a R data frame or matrix in a tabular display.

props.name: question
props.description: displayed question

props.name: solution
props.description: two-element array containing the endpoints of the correct range

props.name: hintPlacement
props.description: placement of the hints (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: hints
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: feedback
props.description: controls whether to display feedback buttons

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether the element should have an integrated chat

props.name: digits
props.description: number of digits that have to match between solution and user-supplied answer. If not given or set to null, the component checks for strict equality. If set to 0, checks for integer equality.

props.name: max
props.description: maximum input value

props.name: min
props.description: minimum input value

props.name: provideFeedback
props.description: indicates whether feedback including the correct answer should be displayed after learners submit their answers

props.name: onChangeLower
props.description: callback triggered after the lower bound is changed by the user

props.name: onChangeUpper
props.description: callback triggered after the upper bound is changed by the user

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback invoked when answer is submitted; has as first parameter a `boolean` indicating whether the answer was correctly anwered (if applicable, `null` otherwise) and the supplied answer as the second parameter

RangeQuestion.description: A range question component that asks students to supply a lower and upper end point.

props.name: audio
props.description: indicates whether audio should be recorded

props.name: camera
props.description: indicates whether webcam should be recorded

props.name: screen
props.description: indicates whether the screen should be captured

props.name: autostart
props.description: indicates whether recording should start immediately

props.name: downloadable
props.description: indicates whether users should be able to download the recoding

props.name: uploadable
props.description: indicates whether users should be able to upload the recoding to the server

props.name: bitsPerSecond
props.description: bits per second

props.name: voiceID
props.description: voice control identifier

Recorder.description: An ISLE component for recording audio, screen and video.

props.name: message
props.description: message to be displayed when content is hidden

Revealer.description: An ISLE component that instructors to selectively reveal or hide children content.

props.name: active
props.description: controls whether the runner should be active. Upon activation, the `onEvaluate` function is called in the given interval (or once)

props.name: interval
props.description: number of milliseconds between invocations of `onEvaluate`. If no interval is set, the function is only invoked once

props.name: onEvaluate
props.description: function to be invoked

Runner.description: The runner component will execute a supplied function either once or at a given interval.

props.name: question
props.description: question for which the student has to select one of the available answer options

props.name: options
props.description: available answer options from which the student can select

props.name: solution
props.description: question solution (must be equal to one of the answer options)

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: preselected answer option

props.name: inline
props.description: controls whether the component is rendered inline or not

props.name: hintPlacement
props.description: placement of the hints (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: hints
props.description: hints providing guidance on how to answer the question

props.name: feedback
props.description: controls whether to display feedback buttons

props.name: chat
props.description: controls whether the element should have an integrated chat

props.name: provideFeedback
props.description: indicates whether feedback including the correct answer should be displayed after learners submit their answers

props.name: failureMsg
props.description: message to be displayed when student selects a wrong answer

props.name: successMsg
props.description: message to be displayed when student selects the correct answer

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback  which is triggered after the submit action

props.name: onSubmit
props.description: callback invoked when answer is submitted; has as first parameter a `boolean` indicating whether the answer was correctly anwered (if applicable, `null` otherwise) and the supplied answer as the second parameter

props.name: autoSave
props.description: controls whether the editor should save the current text to the local storage of the browser at a given time interval

props.name: intervalTime
props.description: time between auto saves

props.name: hideRecordingButtons
props.description: controls whether to hide the recording buttons

props.name: hideSaveButtons
props.description: controls whether to hide the save buttons

props.name: hideTransmitButtons
props.description: controls whether to hide buttons for transmitting user actions

props.name: brushSize
props.description: size of the brush to paint with

props.name: color
props.description: color of the brush and texts

props.name: canvasWidth
props.description: width of the canvas element (in px)

props.name: canvasHeight
props.description: height of the canvas element (in px)

props.name: fullscreen
props.description: controls whether to automatically resize the canvas to the width and height of the browser window

props.name: fill
props.description: if `horizontal`, fill all available horizontal space when drawing a PDF; if `vertical`, all vertical space is used to prevent y-axis overflow

props.name: disabled
props.description: whether to make the component read-only and forbid drawing on the sketchboard

props.name: fontFamily
props.description: font family

props.name: fontSize
props.description: font size

props.name: nodes
props.description: components to be rendered on top of specified slides; `keys` should correspond to page numbers, `values` to the components

props.name: noPages
props.description: initial number of pages

props.name: pdf
props.description: Link to PDF file for baked-in page backgrounds

props.name: showTutorial
props.description: show a tutorial for the sketchpad

props.name: transmitOwner
props.description: whether owner actions should be transmitted to other users in real-time

props.name: groupMode
props.description: controls whether all user's actions are transmitted to everyone else

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback invoked whenever a new line element is drawn

Sketchpad.description: A drawing sketchpad for note taking on lecture slides or empty pages.

props.name: title
props.description: title for the slideshow / carousel to be displayed at its top

props.name: dots
props.description: display dots at the bottom for quickly navigating to any slide

props.name: fade
props.description: controls whether fading is used for transitioning between the slides

props.name: draggable
props.description: controls whether users can drag the slides to navigate between them

props.name: goto
props.description: If property is changed, the component jumps to the slide with the selected index

props.name: infinite
props.description: controls whether the slideshow wraps around it's contents

props.name: interval
props.description: sets a time interval for an automatic slide change

props.name: onClick
props.description: callback invoked when clicking on the next/previous buttons

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: swipeToSlide
props.description: enables drag/swipe behavior

Slider.description: A component which displays its children in a slideshow or carousel.

Appear.description: Wrapped elements in the appear tag makes them appear/disappear in order in response to navigation.

BlockQuote.description: A styled blockquote. Should be used in conjunction with the Spectacle `Cite` and `Quote` tags.

Cite.description: Component wrapping the citation source. Should be used in conjunction with the Spectacle `BlockQuote` and `Quote` tags.

Fill.description: The fill tag takes up all the space available to it. Fill tags next to each other form an equidistant grid.

Fit.description: Component taking up as much space as its bounds provide, but not more.

Layout.description: Component wrapping `Fit` and `Fill` tags to provide a row.

Quote.description: Component wrapping a quote. Should be used in conjunction with the Spectacle `BlockQuote` and `Cite` tags.

props.name: id
props.description: component identifier

SurveyGenerator.description: Component allowing instructors to create multiple-choice surveys, free text surveys and number surveys on the fly in real-time through an easy-to-use interface.

props.name: tooltip
props.description: tooltip displayed when hovering over the switch element
props.default: Click to cycle through available options.

props.name: tooltipPos
props.description: placement of the tooltip (either `top`, `left`, `right`, or `bottom`)

props.name: className
props.description: class name for the enclosing span element

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback invoked when elements are switched. Receives as its first argument the index of the currently displayed child

Switch.description: The Switch component allows the display of one element out of a list of several elements. Users can cycle through the different children of the Switch tag by clicking on the currently displayed one.

props.name: raw
props.description: The literal LaTeX `string` to render. Also accepts `numbers`

props.name: displayMode
props.description: `boolean` indicating whether to display the equation inline or in display mode

props.name: numbered
props.description: controls whether to display an equation number for display mode equations

props.name: style
props.description: `object` with CSS key-value pairs to be applied to the equation container

props.name: tag
props.description: Custom characters displayed for display equations at the right side. Defaults to the number of the equation inside the lesson

props.name: elems
props.description: `object` with `keys` denoting LaTeX characters and their corresponding values being configuration `objects` to make them interactive. Setting a `tooltip` option will show a tooltip when hovering over the LaTeX characters. Setting a `variable` property will display an input slider to change the respective state variable; in this case, additional properties `legend`, `min`, `max`, and `step` are supported

props.name: onClick
props.description: callback `function` invoked whenever a user clicks on the equation

TeX.description: `TeX` is an ISLE element that can be used to display LaTeX equations. Under the hood, the component uses [KaTeX](https://github.com/Khan/KaTeX) for blazingly fast rendering.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: default value of the text area,

props.name: disabled
props.description: controls whether the text area shall be disabled

props.name: legend
props.description: legend text

props.name: onChange
props.description: callback function invoked with the new text when the area text changes

props.name: placeholder
props.description: placeholder text

props.name: resizable
props.description: controls whether the text area shall be resizable

props.name: rows
props.description: number of rows

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

TextArea.description: A text area component. Used as a stand-alone component, changes should be handled via the `onChange` attribute.

props.name: raw
props.description: text to be rendered

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: voiceID
props.description: voice control identifier

Text.description: Text component, which allows rendering of raw text as Markdown and enables voice control.

props.name: id
props.description: the unique `string` ID for the timer. The timer component is persistent over page refreshes

props.name: active
props.description: flag that can be toggled to start or pause the timer

props.name: duration
props.description: duration in seconds for the timer

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onTimeUp
props.description: callback invoked when the timer runs out

Timer.description: Displays a timer that will trigger a predefined callback when the time is up. An example use case is the timing of quizzes.

props.name: tooltip
props.description: tooltip content

props.name: placement
props.description: direction of the tooltip

props.name: active
props.description: controls whether the counter should be active

props.name: delay
props.description: number of milliseconds before component appears

Unveil.description: The appear component will cause all of its children to become visible after a specified amount of time.

props.name: url
props.description: URL of the video

props.name: controls
props.description: indicates whether to display control elements of the video player

props.name: playing
props.description: indictes whether to automatically start playing the video

props.name: volume
props.description: volume of the player

props.name: center
props.description: controls whether to center the video player

props.name: height
props.description: height of the player

props.name: width
props.description: width of the player

props.name: loop
props.description: controls whether to start the video anew after it was played

props.name: voiceID
props.description: voice control identifier

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

props.name: onEnded
props.description: callback invoked once the video ends

props.name: onPause
props.description: callback invoked once the video pauses

props.name: onPlay
props.description: callback invoked once the video starts or resumes playing after pausing

VideoPlayer.description: A component for playing media files and content from YouTube, SoundCloud and Vimeo.

props.name: id
props.description: unique identifier

props.name: commands
props.description: array of voice commands

props.name: hide
props.description: controls whether to hide control elements for toggling on/off voice control and display a list of available commands

props.name: reference
props.description: reference object

VoiceControl.description: Component to register a reference with the speech control interface.

props.name: key
props.description: APIXU key

props.name: language
props.description: language identifier

props.name: location
props.description: location name

props.name: voiceID
props.description: voice control identifier

props.name: style
props.description: CSS inline styles

Weather.description: A component for displaying the current weather at a designated location.

props.name: invisible
props.description: controls whether to display a text input field to search for Wikipedia articles

props.name: language
props.description: language identifier

Wikipedia.description: The **Wikipedia** component scans the **Wikipedia** and returns an article - if anything valid is found under the entered search tem.

props.name: data
props.description: either an array of texts from which to generate the word cloud or, if `precalculated` is set to `true`, and array of word count objects (with `text` and `value` keys)

props.name: font
props.description: accessor function specifying the font face for each word. Also accepts a constant instead of a function

props.name: fontSizeMapper
props.description: accessor function indicating the font size for each word. Defaults to `( count - min ) / ( max - min ) * 36.0 + 14.0`, where `min` and `max` denote the minimum and maximum word `counts`, respectively

props.name: height
props.description: height of the word clloud (in px)

props.name: language
props.description: language identifier (determines the stopwords to be removed)

props.name: minCount
props.description: if set, only include words that appear more than `minCount` times in the given data

props.name: saveButton
props.description: controls whether to display a button for saving the word cloud as an image

props.name: onClick
props.description: callback function invoked when a word on the word cloud is clicked

props.name: padding
props.description: accessor function or constant indicating the numerical padding for each word

props.name: precalculated
props.description: controls whether the word cloud expects an array of precalculated word counts or will generate them for given texts

props.name: rotate
props.description: accessor function indicating the rotation angle (in degrees) for each word. Also accepts a constant instead of a function

props.name: width
props.description: width of the word cloud (in px)

WordCloud.description: A word cloud component built on top of [d3-cloud](https://github.com/jasondavies/d3-cloud).
